DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient experienced chemotherapy-related toxicity.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a toxicity (the degree to which something is poisonous) event and chemotherapy (the use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: Something that happens at a given place and time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient experience ch
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience chemotherapy-related toxicity (excluding alopecia, nail changes, dysgeusia, hot flashes/flushes, sexual/reproductive function)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience a reportable toxicity that delayed the start of the next cycle's first day of chemotherapy for greater or equal to 72 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience a reportable toxicity that delayed the start of the next EPI cycle for greater than or equal to 4 weeks from the expected start date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient received 4-5 months of chemotherapy pre- study entry,was it due to toxicity?

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-2 2018371v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
